homepage.presentation: Hello and welcome to my portfolio. Former ambulance driver, I have just completed my professional retraining and am now a web developer.
homepage.curriculum: I have pursued two training programs with the National School of Computer Science.
homepage.keen: Passionate about various web technologies and their applications, I successfully completed my training as a web and mobile web developer at ENI in December 2022.
homepage.opportunity: I had the opportunity to complete two internships during my training.
homepage.firstIntership1: The first internship, lasting for 3 weeks, took place at .
homepage.firstIntership2: During this time, I contributed to the creation of a Quiz application designed for escape room venues, utilizing technologies such as Vue.js, Node.js, Docker, and MongoDb.
homepage.secondIntership1: My second internship, spanning a duration of 2 months, was hosted at
homepage.secondIntership2: Throughout this period, I continued the development of their ERP using PHP and Symfony.
homepage.workStudy1: I continued with Quantior in an
homepage.workStudy2: from December 2022 to July 2023 and successfully earned my diploma as an Application Designer and Developer (Level 6 RNCP).
homepage.workStudy3: During this apprenticeship, I worked with technologies such as Angular, NestJs, Docker, and MySQL on the project aimed at developing Version 2 of Quantior's ERP. Additionally, I took charge of deploying the solution into production, including setting up an Apache server on Debian.
homepage.skill: During my training, I had the opportunity to enhance my skills in Java, PHP, Javascript, and SQL. I also learned about adhering to conventions and implementing design patterns.
homepage.sideProject: I also dedicated time to completing several personal projects. I developed an application tailored for climbers using Angular and Nest, as well as an application for hikers built on Symfony. Additionally, I created my first portfolio using Vue.js. Concurrently, I addressed requests from clients for the creation of their websites. In December 2022, I launched my inaugural website online, titled 'MetaHomeopathie', which you can explore among my achievements.

curriculum.transition: As a transitioning developer, following my initial diploma from ENI (DWWM), I opted to pursue further education to specialize more deeply in the back-end.
curriculum.certification: I earned my CDA certification in July 2023 after a 6-month apprenticeship with Quantior Group. My objective is to secure a full-stack developer position with a strong preference for Java/NodeJs-Angular technologies.
curriculum.climbing: Rock Climbing/Mountaineering (Regular practice both outdoors and indoors).
curriculum.cdaTitle: Professional Title: Application Designer and Developer (Level 6 RNCP Title, equivalent to Bachelors +4).
curriculum.dwwmTitle: Preparation for Professional Title: Web and Mobile Web Developer (Level 5 RNCP Title).
curriculum.dejeps: Preparation for DEJEPS in Natural Rock Climbing.
curriculum.hq6v2: Development of a V2 for the internal ERP: revamping with a REST API using NodeJS and frontend in Angular. Simultaneous corrections on the V1 and deployment of the V2 into production. Technologies used: NodeJS (Nest), Angular 15, OpenAPI, Docker.
curriculum.hq6v1: Development of an internal company management solution (ERP). Management of inventory, invoices, and deployment to production. Technologies used: Symfony 5 / PHP7 / docker / Git.
curriculum.graaly: Development of a mobile quiz creation application. Technologies used: VueJs / NodeJS / Quasar / Git.
curriculum.deaExp: State-certified ambulance driver in various companies
curriculum.airForceExp: Protection and security of military sites Group management

project.metaDescription: Showcase website for the presentation of MetaHomeopathy, technique, and laboratory. The missing link between Hahnemannian homeopathy and modern quantum sciences: MetaHomeopathy.
project.oneRouteDescription: Website designed for climbers, allowing them to discover climbing sites with all the necessary information, including overnight parking spots, and to mark the completed routes. Display of climbing statistics.
project.carnetDescription: Notebook app for mountain outings. Hiking / Multi-pitch Climbing / Mountaineering. Outing statistics among users and liking of outings.
project.eniSortirDescription: Development of an OVS-like website, completed in 15 days: Group project as part of the DWWM training at ENI.
project.eniEnchere: Creation of a website similar to Le Bon Coin, accomplished in 15 days: Group project as part of the DWWM training at ENI.
project.twsDescription: Creation and operational deployment of a GitLab instance in response to a request from an independent web developer.
